com.ibm.hrl.xmleditor.extension.tool
Interface ToolHandler

All Known Implementing Classes:
XSLHandler, BMLPlayer
public interface ToolHandler
extends Extension

This interface defines the methods any general Tool Handler should implement. Having this interface enables the developer to invoke 3rd party tools which work on xml documents. Any tool handler should implement the ToolHandler interface and a constructor with an empty argument list. Warning: this class may not be compatible with future releases.

Method Summary
 boolean canHandle(XMLDocumentContext _docContext)
          Asks the Tool Handler if it can start handling the document represented by an XMLDocumentContext.
 boolean handle(XMLDocumentContext _docContext)
          Tells the handler to start handling the document represented by an XMLDocumentContext.
 
Methods inherited from interface com.ibm.hrl.xmleditor.extension.Extension
getIcon, getName, getToolTip, init, setXMLEditorContext
 

Method Detail

canHandle

public boolean canHandle(XMLDocumentContext _docContext)
Asks the Tool Handler if it can start handling the document represented by an XMLDocumentContext. This method is intended to help in enabling/disabling the Menu/Toolbar item representing this tool.
Parameters:
_docContext - the document.
Returns:
true if handling can be started.

handle

public boolean handle(XMLDocumentContext _docContext)
Tells the handler to start handling the document represented by an XMLDocumentContext.
Parameters:
_docContext - the document.
Returns:
true if handling was successful.
